Graduate employability in India: Why Tier-1 colleges win bigger in non-tech jobs
description: A tier-wise snapshot from Mercer | Mettl’s India’s Graduate Skill Index 2025 shows Tier-1 colleges lead overall employability. But the gap doesn’t behave the same across roles. Technical employability is relatively close across tiers. Non-tech roles widen the spread. That suggests hiring rewards workplace-ready performance—writing, presentation, judgement—often shaped by campus exposure. For colleges, the message for colleges is that build this training into daily teaching and assessment, not as a last-minute add-on.

description: Former Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi expressed regret over Pakistan's government decision to boycott the T20 World Cup match against India, stating he stands behind the government. This stance contrasts with his past remarks on keeping sports and politics separate, drawing criticism for seemingly supporting political interference in a major tournament.

3,500-year-old rhino bone fragments found in Western Ghats rewrite India’s wildlife map
description: Archaeological findings of rhino bones near Coimbatore reveal the species once roamed southern India, significantly expanding its known ancient range. This discovery contrasts with current conservation data showing the one-horned rhinoceros is now confined to specific regions in Northeast India and West Bengal, where populations are steadily increasing due to dedicated conservation efforts.

Union ministers Amit Shah and Rajnath Singh objected, citing parliamentary rules against citing unpublished material. Gandhi defended his reference, stating it pertained to the Prime Minister's character.

He questioned the logic behind the conditional approval, suggesting it's a ploy to mislead people and project solidarity with Bangladesh. Singh highlighted the ICC's rejection of Bangladesh's request and Pakistan's past revenue-driven approach to matches despite political tensions.

The film saw significant growth over the Republic Day holiday, collecting Rs 59 crore on its first Monday. After a robust first week totaling Rs 224.25 crore, 'Border 2' continued its box office run, ultimately reaching Rs 275.86 crore.

description: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee arrived in Delhi for a meeting with the Election Commission amid political tension. She protested a heavy police presence outside Banga Bhavan, comparing the treatment to that of Union home minister Amit Shah's visits to West Bengal. Banerjee vowed to fight against alleged atrocities and harassment of people from Bengal.

title: 'A total loser': Trump lashes out at Trevor Noah over Epstein Island joke at Grammys
description: President Donald Trump has threatened to sue comedian Trevor Noah for defamation after Noah joked during the Grammy Awards that Trump visited Epstein Island with Bill Clinton. Trump vehemently denied the accusation on Truth Social, calling Noah a "talentless dope" and vowing to send his lawyers after him.

Tharoor also commented on the Mustafizur Rahman situation, deeming Bangladesh's reaction an overreaction.

title: Pune Porsche case: SC grants regular bail to 3 accused in juvenile blood swap
description: The Supreme Court has granted regular bail to three individuals accused in the Pune Porsche crash case. The incident, which occurred on May 19, 2024, involved a 17-year-old allegedly driving a Porsche Taycan and fatally striking two 24-year-old tech professionals.

title: Techie in SUV blows kisses at woman sitting in car in Noida, trails her
description: Noida police apprehended two IT engineers for allegedly harassing a woman with obscene gestures from their car. The incident, which occurred late at night, saw the accused persistently follow the victim's vehicle and engage in indecent behavior.

title: 'I have been further linked' to Epstein: Ex-UK minister resigns from Labour Party
description: Former British ambassador Peter Mandelson has quit the Labour Party following renewed scrutiny over his links to Jeffrey Epstein. Newly released US documents allege Epstein made payments totaling $75,000 to Mandelson in the early 2000s. Mandelson, who has no recollection of these transfers, stated he doesn't want to cause further embarrassment to the party while he investigates the claims.

Raut alleged that Pawar was seeking reconciliation with his uncle Sharad Pawar and faced pressure over the irrigation scam, drawing parallels to the Justice Loya case.

title: Video: 11 injured as SUV ploughs into crowd during festival rush; driver thrashed
description: A shocking incident unfolded on Sangli's Tilak Road as an SUV driver, Praniket Dattatrey Panchal, mowed down multiple vehicles and a crowd gathered for the Krushnamai Festival.  The driver was assaulted by locals before police intervention.  Eleven people, including five officers, sustained injuries, many with fractures, and were hospitalized.  A case has been filed.

description: Drake Maye and his wife, Ann Michael Maye, are the new fan favorites after their love story inspired billions around the world. The two have hardly been married for a year as many are now speculating that the star player has allegedly cheated on his newly wed wife. This originated after a few pictures went viral and here's all about the truth behind it.

title: Travis Kelce steps back from drama and retirement rumours as Swift wedding stalls
description: Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce's wedding have the whole world waiting but now, there are rumors of their wedding being reportedly delayed as the two deal with retirement rumors. Amid all this, it seems the star player is now taking a break from his regular life as he is all set to make a rare appearance in Arizona, possibly without Taylor Swift.

Oracle may layoff up to 30,000; one of the reasons is firm's 'commitment'
description: Oracle faces potential job cuts of 20,000-30,000 to fund its massive $156 billion OpenAI partnership. The company has already incurred significant debt for data centers, and rising borrowing costs are stalling projects. OpenAI is reportedly shifting some capacity to Microsoft and Amazon, raising concerns about Oracle's delivery capabilities.

title: IMF data puts India above US in 2026 GDP growth, Elon Musk reacts
description: Elon Musk highlighted a significant global economic shift, noting India's projected contribution to worldwide growth surpassing the United States. This observation aligns with India's robust domestic strength, accelerated manufacturing, and resilient consumer demand, positioning it as a key driver of global expansion alongside China.
